definition: A mark or blemish on the skin that remains after a wound has healed, often resulting in a visible and permanent scar. It is commonly used to describe the lasting mark left behind by an injury or surgical incision.

examples.german: Die Narbe auf ihrem Arm war gut verheilt.
examples.english: The scar on her arm had healed well.

examples.german: Er hat eine große Narbe auf seiner Stirn.
examples.english: He has a big scar on his forehead.

examples.german: Die Operation hinterließ eine Narbe am Bauch.
examples.english: The surgery left a scar on the stomach.

examples.german: Die Narbe erinnert ihn an den Unfall.
examples.english: The scar reminds him of the accident.

examples.german: Sie verdeckte ihre Narben mit langen Ärmeln.
examples.english: She covered her scars with long sleeves.
